qas.question: What former managing director od Goldman Sachs international division is president of The European Central Bank?
What is the official, central bank for the euro?

answers.text: consists of 19 EU member states and is one of the largest currency areas in the world

qas.question: Who owns the capital stock of The European Central Bank?

answers.text: the central banks of all 28 EU member states

qas.question: What established The European Central Bank?
What former managing director of Goldman Sachs international division is no longer president of The European Central Bank?
What is the unofficial, central bank for the euro?

plausible_answers.text: consists of 19 EU member states and is one of the largest currency areas in the world

qas.question: What is falsely considered the Eurozone?

plausible_answers.text: the central banks of all 28 EU member states

qas.question: Who owns none of the capital stock of The European Central Bank?
What destroyed The European Central Bank?

context: <a1_0><b6_0>The European Central Bank<b6_0/><a1_0/> (ECB) is the central bank for the euro and administers monetary policy of the Eurozone, which <a2_0><b7_0>consists of 19 EU member states and is one of the largest currency areas in the world<b7_0/><a2_0/>. It is one of the world's most important central banks and is one of the seven institutions of the European Union (EU) listed in the Treaty on European Union (TEU). The capital stock of the bank is owned by <a3_0><b8_0>the central banks of all 28 EU member states<b8_0/><a3_0/>.[dated info] <a4_0><b9_0>The Treaty of Amsterdam<b9_0/><a4_0/> established the bank in 1998, and it is headquartered in Frankfurt, Germany. As of 2015[update] the President of the ECB is <a0_0><b5_0>Mario Draghi<b5_0/><a0_0/>, former governor of the Bank of Italy, former member of the World Bank, and former managing director of the Goldman Sachs international division (2002–2005). The bank primarily occupied the Eurotower prior to, and during, the construction of the new headquarters.
